title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: Total Range: 1999-2024 District-level (school-level data) Includes grade-level enrollment (K-12) School-level district-level data Demographic percentages converted counts Includes special populations (economically disadvantaged, LEP, special ed)

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: Modern data: school-profile-YYYY-YYYY.xlsx district-profile-YYYY-YYYY.xlsx https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/education/data/ Historical data: ASR ZIP files https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/education/documents/asr/

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: test suite verifies: - Inf/NaN percentages output (division zero protection) - Non-zero state-level enrollment totals - Expected subgroups present (demographics, special populations) - Grade-level data present ASR era - District sums approximately match state totals - Percentages valid 0-1 range

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: tidy=TRUE MUST maintain fidelity raw, unprocessed file data - Enrollment counts must match source data - Percentages calculated counts, estimated - synthetic/interpolated values - Missing data represented NA, 0

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: Modern era: Uses percentage columns (e.g., white_pct), converted counts using round(pct/100 * total) ASR era: Uses direct count columns grades State row: Modern era includes state row district data (district_no=0); ASR era requires aggregation

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Tennessee School Data Package (tnschooldata)
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

what: 1. Tennessee has nearly 1 million public school students
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: Volunteer State’s public school enrollment grown steadily.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2006, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024))  statewide <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)  statewide ggplot(statewide, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students / 1e6)) +   geom_line(color = "#FF6600", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#FF6600", size = 3) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), vjust = -1, size = 3.5) +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::label_number(suffix = "M"),     limits = c(0.85, 1.05)   ) +   labs(     title = "Tennessee Public School Enrollment",     subtitle = "Nearly 1 million students in K-12 public schools",     x = "Year",     y = "Total Students"   )

what: 2. Shelby County dwarfs all other districts
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: Memphis’s district students next three combined.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  top_districts <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts top_districts %>%   mutate(district_name = reorder(district_name, n_students)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = n_students / 1000, y = district_name)) +   geom_col(fill = "#FF6600") +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(     labels = scales::label_number(suffix = "K"),     expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))   ) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 Tennessee School Districts by Enrollment (2024)",     subtitle = "Shelby County: Tennessee's largest district by far",     x = "Students (thousands)",     y = NULL   )

what: 3. Hispanic enrollment has surged across Tennessee
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: One fastest demographic shifts Southeast.
code: demographics <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students) %>%   mutate(subgroup = factor(subgroup,     levels = c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian"),     labels = c("White", "Black", "Hispanic", "Asian")))  demographics ggplot(demographics, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students / 1000, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_manual(values = c(     "White" = "#4292C6",     "Black" = "#807DBA",     "Hispanic" = "#41AB5D",     "Asian" = "#EF6548"   )) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_number(suffix = "K")) +   labs(     title = "Demographic Shifts in Tennessee Public Schools",     subtitle = "Hispanic enrollment growing rapidly; White enrollment declining",     x = "Year",     y = "Students (thousands)",     color = "Race/Ethnicity"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

what: 4. Middle Tennessee is booming while Memphis struggles
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: Nashville metro driving statewide growth.
code: enr_regional <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2024))  middle_tn <- c("Davidson", "Williamson", "Rutherford", "Wilson", "Sumner") memphis_area <- c("Shelby")  regional <- enr_regional %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(region = case_when(     grepl(paste(middle_tn, collapse = "|"), district_name) ~ "Middle TN",     grepl(paste(memphis_area, collapse = "|"), district_name) ~ "Memphis Area",     TRUE ~ "Other"   )) %>%   filter(region %in% c("Middle TN", "Memphis Area")) %>%   group_by(end_year, region) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  regional regional_wide <- regional %>%   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = total) %>%   mutate(pct_change = round((`2024` - `2015`) / `2015` * 100, 1))  ggplot(regional, aes(x = factor(end_year), y = total / 1000, fill = region)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge", width = 0.7) +   geom_text(     aes(label = scales::comma(total)),     position = position_dodge(width = 0.7),     vjust = -0.5,     size = 3.5   ) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Middle TN" = "#41AB5D", "Memphis Area" = "#EF6548")) +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::label_number(suffix = "K"),     expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))   ) +   labs(     title = "Middle Tennessee vs Memphis Area Enrollment",     subtitle = "Nashville suburbs growing rapidly; Shelby County declining",     x = "Year",     y = "Students (thousands)",     fill = "Region"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

what: 5. Williamson County is Tennessee’s fastest-growing district
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: affluent Nashville suburb keeps expanding.
code: enr_growth <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2024))  growth <- enr_growth %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) %>%   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) %>%   filter(!is.na(`2015`) & !is.na(`2024`) & `2015` > 5000) %>%   mutate(     change = `2024` - `2015`,     pct_change = round(change / `2015` * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(desc(pct_change)) %>%   head(10)  growth growth %>%   mutate(district_name = reorder(district_name, pct_change)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = pct_change, y = district_name)) +   geom_col(fill = "#41AB5D") +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0("+", pct_change, "%")), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(     labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1),     expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))   ) +   labs(     title = "Fastest-Growing Tennessee Districts (2015-2024)",     subtitle = "Minimum 5,000 students in 2015",     x = "Enrollment Growth",     y = NULL   )

what: 6. English Learners are transforming Tennessee classrooms
title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: multilingual future already .
code: enr_el <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2014, 2019, 2024))  el_trend <- enr_el %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(pct_change = round((n_students / first(n_students) - 1) * 100, 1))  el_trend ggplot(el_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students / 1000)) +   geom_area(fill = "#41AB5D", alpha = 0.3) +   geom_line(color = "#41AB5D", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#41AB5D", size = 3) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), vjust = -1, size = 3.5) +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::label_number(suffix = "K"),     limits = c(0, NA)   ) +   labs(     title = "English Learners in Tennessee Schools",     subtitle = "Rapid growth over the past decade",     x = "Year",     y = "English Learners (thousands)"   )

title: 10 Insights from Tennessee School Enrollment Data
text: See quickstart guide examples.
code: library(tnschooldata)  # Fetch recent years enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024)  # State totals enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Your district enr %>%   filter(grepl("Knox", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level == "TOTAL")

title: tnschooldata
text: Fetch analyze Tennessee school enrollment data Tennessee Department Education (TDOE) R Python.

title: tnschooldata
text: can install development version tnschooldata GitHub:

title: tnschooldata
code: library(tnschooldata)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get historical data from 2005 (2004-05 school year) enr_2005 <- fetch_enr(2005)  # Get wide format (one row per school) enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Get multiple years at once enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # Get historical range (district-level only for pre-2012) enr_historical <- fetch_enr_multi(1999:2005)  # Filter to specific district (Knox County) knox <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_id == "0470")  # Get state totals state_totals <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")

title: tnschooldata
code: import pytnschooldata as tn  # Fetch 2024 data (2023-24 school year) enr = tn.fetch_enr(2024)  # Statewide total total = enr[enr['is_state'] & (enr['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]['n_students'].sum() print(f"{total:,} students")  # Get multiple years enr_multi = tn.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # Check available years years = tn.get_available_years() print(f"Data available: {years['min_year']}-{years['max_year']}")

title: tnschooldata
text: Total: 26 years data (1999-2024)

title: tnschooldata
text: Membership files: Enrollment grade, gender, race/ethnicity Profile files: District/school names demographics Interactive dashboard downloadable data Includes enrollment, demographics, achievement data Comprehensive annual education statistics

title: tnschooldata
text: State: Tennessee statewide totals District: ~150 school districts (LEAs) School/Campus: ~1,800 public schools

title: tnschooldata
text: Pre-K (offered) Kindergarten Grades 1-12

title: tnschooldata
text: Data Capture Date: Enrollment data reflects October 1 membership counts Small Cell Suppression: Values 10 may suppressed privacy Charter Schools: Reported separate districts years Virtual Schools: Included district totals Pre-2011 Demographics: Asian Pacific Islander combined Pre-2011 Multiracial: Two races category available Historical Era (1999-2011): district-level enrollment grade available (school-level data, demographics) Year 2000 Data: 1999-00 school year ASR file may experience download issues networks

title: tnschooldata
text: Tennessee uses following identifier system: District ID: 4 digits, zero-padded (e.g., 0470 = Knox County, 0791 = Shelby County) School ID: 4 digits within district Campus ID: 8 digits = District ID + School ID (e.g., 04700005)

title: tnschooldata
text: Tennessee organized 8 CORE (Centers Regional Excellence) regions:

text: Downloaded data cached locally avoid repeated downloads:
code: # View cache status cache_status()  # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear specific year clear_cache(2024)  # Force fresh download enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)

Fetch Tennessee enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Tennessee Department Education data portal.

title: Fetch Tennessee enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 1999-2024. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download TDOE.

title: Fetch Tennessee enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns. Note: Historical years (1999-2011) include district-level data.

title: Fetch Tennessee enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data available 1999-2024: 1999-2011: Historical data Annual Statistical Report (ASR) - district-level 2012-2024: Modern data portal - includes school-level data

title: Fetch Tennessee enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get historical data from 2005 enr_2005 <- fetch_enr(2005)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district (Knox County) knox_county <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_id == "0470") } # }

what: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Tennessee Department Education (TDOE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Education Information System (EIS) Report Card data, transforming tidy format analysis.

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years Get available data years

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Tennessee uses following ID system: District IDs: 4 digits, zero-padded (e.g., 0470 = Knox County) School IDs: 4 digits within district Campus IDs: 8 digits (district ID + school ID)

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Tennessee Department Education: Data Downloads: https://www.tn.gov/education/districts/federal-programs--oversight/data/data-downloads.html State Report Card: https://tdepublicschools.ondemand.sas.com/ Annual Statistical Report: https://www.tn.gov/education/districts/federal-programs--oversight/data/department-reports.html

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Tennessee data available two main eras: Legacy Era (2012-2018): Older Excel format files Modern Era (2019-2024): Standardized Report Card data system

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Tennessee divided 8 CORE (Centers Regional Excellence) regions: Region 1: Upper East Tennessee Region 2: East Tennessee Region 3: Southeast Tennessee Region 4: Upper Cumberland Region 5: Mid-Cumberland (Nashville area) Region 6: South Central Tennessee Region 7: Northwest Tennessee Region 8: Southwest Tennessee (Memphis area)

title: tnschooldata: Fetch and Process Tennessee School Data — tnschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
